Community Involvement

At Gottwals and Walls of Books®, we maintain partnerships with civic groups, schools, churches, and charities.

To keep abreast of school reading needs, we make sure local families know Gottwals Books and Walls of Books® will have their school books in stock. We also do promotions that include giveaways, discounts, and all kinds of family fun. Gottwals Books and Walls of Books® host book clubs, kids book readings, and author events. We are always coming up with fresh, new ideas to keep the customers flocking through the doors.

On top of all this, we donate thousands of books to local groups each and every year!

Some of our community partners include:

Covenant Care Adoption Services

Covenant Care Adoption Services provides services to women facing unplanned pregnancies, pointing them to the life-affirming option of adoption into loving two-parent, Christian homes. Covenant Care is based in Macon but has caseworkers throughout Georgia.

Shane Gottwals currently serves on the CCS Board of Directors, and Gottwals Books has sponsored their annual events for many years.

Caring Solutions Pregnancy Centers

Caring Solutions is made up of medical professionals and trained individuals who are ready to help women facing unplanned pregnancies. They provide compassionate care and commitment to each person they see. Caring Solutions offers life-affirming guidance to women at a critical time.

Abbey Gottwals is a former volunteer for this ministry, and Gottwals Books has sponsored their annual events for many years.

Central Fellowship Christian Academy

Central Fellowship Christian Academy is a private Christian school based in Macon, GA. The school is part of Central Fellowship Baptist Church and has ministered since 1970.

Shane Gottwals is an alumnus of CFCA, along with his brother, Jason. Both Shane and his mother, Gherry Gottwals, are former teachers at the school. Shane currently serves as the school board chairman.
